text: Leila Pahlavi (, 27 March 1970 â€“ 10 June 2001) was a princess of Iran and the youngest daughter of Mohammad Reza Pahlavi, Shah of Iran, and his third wife, Farah Pahlavi. On 10 June 2001, Pahlavi was found dead in her room in Leonard Hotel in London by her doctor. She was found to have more than five times the lethal dose of barbiturate and cocaine. She was found in bed and she suffered from anorexia and bulimia. ==References== Category:1970 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Drug-related deaths in the United Kingdom Category:Drug- related suicides Category:Iranian princes and princesses Category:People from Tehran
title: Leila Pahlavi
